questions.question: Which of the following numbers is written in the standard form?
In a pentagon ABCDE, ∠A=(2x+9°), ∠B=(2x+1°), ∠C=(2x-1°), ∠D=(2x+5°) and ∠E=(2x-4°). Then, the value of (2x+10°) is:
Which one of the following is the most appropriate feature of mathematics textbooks at elementary level?
options: Concepts should be presented from concrete to abstract
The language of the book must be highly precise and technical
Books must contain a lot of similar questions to practice
Concepts should be presented from complex to simple

questions.question: A sum of ₹ 8000 becomes ₹ 9500 at 7.5% p.a. in x years at simple interest. What will be the amount of the sum in the same time at 20% p.a., if interest is compounded yearly?
The two corresponding angles formed by the intersection of two parallel lines by a transversal are (3x - 20°) and (5x - 60°). Then, the value of (4x + 30°) is:
Which of the following is used to record students’ problem solving ability, measurement ability and experimentation ability?
The distance between the parallel sides AB and CD of a trapezium ABCD is 12 cm. If AB<CD, CD=24 cm and AD=BC=13 cm, then the area of the trapezium (in cm²) is:
Following data shows the number of wickets taken by a player in last 11 matches played by him/her: 1, 0, 2, 4, 3, 3, 1, 1, 2, 4, 1. What is the difference between the mean and mode of the above data?
A nine-digit number 565x9274y is divisible by 88. Then, the value of (2x + 3y) is:
Many occupations such as accountancy, banking, shop-keeping, tailoring etc. require mathematics directly or indirectly. This is an explanation of value of Mathematics.
O is a point on line AB. Rays OC and OD are drawn on the same side of AB such that OC ⊥ OD, ∠AOC = x and ∠BOD = 3x. Then, ∠BOD is equal to:
For teaching addition of integers at the upper primary stage which of the following is least useful?
If x=k is the solution of the equation: x/(x-4) - 1 = 3/(5-x), then what is the value of 11k + 18?

Meenu wrote some numbers on the blackboard and arranged them in ascending order as 2 < 7 < 9 < 12. She then multiplied each number by (-2). Identify the correct statement regarding the above situation.
options: Number of terms in the ascending order will change.
Ascending order of numbers will still remain the same.
Mean of the numbers will remain the same.
Ascending order will now be changed to descending order.

questions.question: Which of the following represents the most important capabilities of learners to be assessed in mathematics?
options: Ability to use abstractions to perceive relationships
Ability to memorize all the formulae given in textbook
Ability to apply mathematical concepts to solve problems related to daily life situations
Ability to score full marks in mathematics

questions.question: The cost price of an article is ¥ 750. It is sold for ¥ 608 by giving 24% discount on its marked price. Had it been sold on its marked price, then what would have been the profit percent?

Cards bearing numbers 12, 13, 14, ..., 70, 71 (one number on one card) are kept in a box and then a card is drawn from the box without looking into it. What is the probability that the card drawn has the number which is not a prime?
Which one of the following is a teacher-centred method of teaching mathematics?
The distance covered (in metres) by a wheel of radius 25 cm in 350 rounds is (use π = 22/7):
One of the factors of 20pq^2 + 4pq + 45pr^2 - 60pqr - 6rp is:
Which of the following statements is correct about assessment?
options: Formative Assessment is used after the course completion to assign grades.
Assessment as learning generates opportunities for self-assessment and peer assessment.
Summative Assessment helps to know to what extent the instructional objectives have been achieved while teaching a concept.
‘Assessment for learning’ is a process with no scope of giving feedback.

questions.question: On the basis of the information given in the statement, which of the suggested courses of action logically follow? Statement: Anamika makes conceptual errors while solving problems on mensuration. Course of Action: (I) Teacher gives a lot of hands-on and visual practice to Anamika. (II) Teacher provides the scope of discussion while giving open-ended questions.
options: Neither course of action (I) nor course of action (II)

questions.question: PQRS is a parallelogram in which PQ = (4x + 1) cm, QR = 26 cm, RS = 25 cm and PS = (3y - 1) cm. Then, the value of (3x + 2y) (in cm) is:
Which of the following rational numbers lie between 2/5 and 3/7?
If x is the smallest number which is to be subtracted from 2605 to make it a perfect square, then the value of (4x +7) is :
Let A = 3x^2 - 8x + 11, B = -2x^2 + 12x, C = -4x + 7 and D = 2x^2 - x - 11. If (A+B+C) - D = px^2 + qx + r, then the value of (p+q+r) is:

Nitu is always confused in identifying the transformations. Her mathematics teacher helped her by giving one simple word for each transformation namely: Reflection, Rotation, Translation and Enlargement. Which of the following represents the correct sequence of meaning of each transformation as given above?
options: Flip, Slide, Turn and Bigger Figure
Turn, Slide, Flip and Bigger Figure
Flip, Turn, Slide and Bigger Figure
Slide, Flip, Turn and Bigger Figure

questions.question: For which of the following measurements, the construction of triangle ABC can be done?
options:
AB = 8 cm, BC = 4 cm, 
ZBCA = 90°, 
ZABC = 60°

questions.question: A solid cube of side 12 cm is cut into small solid cubes of side 4 cm each. What will be the relation between the total surface area of the original cube and the new total surface area of the small cubes so formed?
options: New total surface area will be thrice the original total surface area.
New total surface area will be 1/2 of the original total surface area.
New total surface area will be twice the original total surface area.
New total surface area will be 1/3 of the original total surface area.

questions.question: Assertion (A) : Achievement in STEM related courses is influenced by gender. Reason (R) : Problem solving strategies used by boys and girls are different.
options: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is correct explanation of (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not correct explanation of (A).

questions.question: (A) is a technique of vegetative propagation in which a part of the stem or a young branch of a plant is pulled and buried in moist soil, such that the branch is still attached to the parent plant. After some time, roots develop in the buried part and it grows into a new plant. (B) is an example of a plant usually grown through this technique. (A) and (B) respectively are:

Which of the following statements are true? (A) Crystallisation is a chemical change. (B) Photosynthesis is a chemical change. (C) Ripening of fruit is a physical change. (D) Formation of curd from milk is a chemical change.
Which of the following strategies would support inquiry-oriented science teaching?
options: Explaining the difference between real and apparent weight
Demonstrating the loss in weight of an object when immersed in water
Engaging students in floating and sinking activities

questions.question: (A) hormone regulates carbohydrate, protein, and fat metabolism in our body. It is secreted by (B) gland and (C) in our diet impacts the functioning of this gland. (A), (B), (C) respectively are:

Which of the following statements is/are true regarding relative reactivity of metals? (A) Zinc is more reactive than Iron but less reactive than Aluminium. (B) Sodium is more reactive than Potassium and Calcium. (C) Aluminium is more reactive than Magnesium.
Which of the following represents correct matching set in the context of aquatic plants?

The following activity is done in Class VII: Students are given four iron bars, out of which two are bar magnets. They are asked to identify the bar magnets. Which of the following process skills can be promoted through this activity?
Which of the following should not be the purpose of open book assessment in Science?
options: To give opportunity to explore the book
To reduce the fear of assessment in learners
To gauge conceptual understanding of learners
To score more marks in tests

questions.question: The density of medium A is more than medium B but less than medium C. In which medium does the sound travel fastest?
options: Can't be inferred from this information

questions.question: Complete the following table. A, B, C, D, E, F respectively are:
Assertion (A): Convex mirrors are used as rearview-mirrors in vehicles. Reason (R1): They form erect and enlarged image. Reason (R2): They have wider field of view.
options: (A) is true but neither (R1) nor (R2) are correct explanation for (A).
(A) is true and both (R1) and (R2) are correct explanations for (A).
(A) is true and only (R1) is correct explanation for (A).
(A) is true and only (R2) is correct explanation for (A).

questions.question: S1- Self pollination can take place only in bisexual flowers. S2- Cross pollination can take place only in unisexual flowers.
options: S1 is false and S2 is true
Both S1 and S2 are true
Both S1 and S2 are false
S1 is true and S2 is false

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
options: Soil with low water holding capacity has good aeration and high percolation rate.
Soil with low water holding capacity has poor aeration and high percolation rate.
Soil with low water holding capacity has good aeration and low percolation rate.
Soil with low water holding capacity has poor aeration and low percolation rate.

questions.question: Which of the following statements are not true regarding compounds?
options: Compounds show the properties of constituent substances.
Only elements can react to form compounds.
The composition of each compound is always fixed.
Compounds can be separated by physical and chemical methods.

questions.question: Which of the following statements are true in the context of respiration in whales and dolphins?
options: They often come up to the water surface to breathe.

questions.question: Which of the following have the most scope for promoting Art integrated learning in Science?
Assertion (A) : Nichrome is used as a heating element in devices like electric toaster and electric geyser. Reason (R) : Nichrome has high melting point and low resistivity.
options: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is correct explanation for (A)
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not correct explanation for (A)

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding the function of bile juice in human digestive system?
On the basis of the following information, identify the substances which give flame on burning: A Solid No, B Liquid Yes, C Solid Yes, D Liquid No.
Assertion (A): Arteries have thick and elastic walls as compared to veins. Reason (R): The pressure of blood flow in arteries is low as compared to veins.
options: Both (A) and (R) are true and (R) is correct explanation for (A).
Both (A) and (R) are true but (R) is not correct explanation for (A).

questions.question: The buoyant force on an object immersed in liquid acts in:
Which of the following questions is a divergent question?
options: What would happen to gravity if the size of earth is reduced to half?
Why does a ball thrown up come down?
What if there was no gravity on the earth?
How does gravity vary with the altitude?

questions.question: When a ray of light enters from medium A to medium B, its speed decreases and on further entering into medium C, its speed increases. Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from this?
options: Refractive index of A, B, C cannot be compared from above information
Refractive index of A is more than B and C
Refractive index of A is less than B but equal to C
Refractive index of A and C are less than B

questions.question: Which of the following statements is correct? S1: The normal temperature of the human body is 37°C. S2: Heat flows from a body at a higher temperature to a body at lower temperature.
options: S1 is inference and S2 is observation
Both S1 and S2 are observation
Both S1 and S2 are inferences
S1 is observation and S2 is inference

questions.question: (A) Sunita takes 0.5 g of Sodium Carbonate in a test-tube and adds 5 ml of Dilute Hydrochloric acid. (B) She passes the gas produced in the above reaction through Lime water. Which of the following represents the chemical reactions taking place in (A) and (B) ?
options: (A) - NaHCO3 + HCl -> NaCl + H2O + CO2 (B) - CaCO3 + H2O + CO2 -> Ca(HCO3)2
(A) - Na2CO3 + 2HCl -> 2NaCl + H2O + CO2 (B) - CaCO3 + H2O + CO2 -> Ca(HCO3)2
(A) - Na2CO3 + 2HCl -> 2NaCl + H2O + CO2 (B) - Ca(OH)2 + CO2 -> CaCO3 + H2O
(A) - NaHCO3 + HCl -> NaCl + H2O + CO2 (B) - Ca(OH)2 + CO2 -> CaCO3 + H2O

questions.question: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding the nature of science? (A) Scientific ideas are not affected by cultural context. (B) There is no single scientific method.
While ice melts at 0°C, its temperature:
options: first decreases and then remains same

questions.question: Children of all age groups have various ideas which may be different from science concepts. Which of the following statements are true regarding these ideas?

Read the following statements in the context of Laws and theories in Science :
Sl: Laws are generalisation statement whereas theories are explanations.
S2: Laws are very old and theories are contemporary.

S3: Laws can’t be changed whereas theories are subject to change.
options: S3is true whereas S1 and S2 are false
Slis true; S2 and S3 are false
S1 and S2 are true whereas S3 is false
